column3: Read about Activas Diagnostics, LLC, a small business using NIA funding to develop an early diagnostic home monitoring test that evaluates, monitors, and predicts neurological disease status in mild cognitive impairment and Alzheimer’s disease and related disorders.
Read about DiamiR, a small business using NIA funding to develop blood-based tests for early detection of mild cognitive impairment and Alzheimer’s disease.
Read about Obatala Sciences, a small business using NIA funding to further the development of cell therapies for pressure ulcers and related skin injury.

Read about WellSIM Biomedical Technologies, Inc., a small business that has developed ExoDot, a platform that could be used in conjunction with other diagnostic tools to help detect Alzheimer’s disease and establish a clinical diagnosis.
